title: Model Optimization for Resource-Constrained Devices
description: Discuss techniques for model compression, quantization, and pruning to reduce model size and computational cost.

examples.description: Optimizes channel selection and neural network parameters, including the use of a separable CNN, to minimize computational resource requirements.
examples.note: Added for its optimization of channel selection and neural network parameters, demonstrating a focus on minimizing computational resource requirements for real-time applications.

examples.description: Suggests improving computational efficiency through techniques like channel selection and graph sparsification as part of future work.
examples.note: Added for its suggestion of improving computational efficiency, indicating a direction towards optimizing models for resource-constrained devices.

examples.description: Includes selective kernel attention to reduce computational demands and a capsule network designed for improved learning with limited data, suggesting a focus on efficiency.
examples.note: Added for its inclusion of selective kernel attention and a capsule network, which are aimed at reducing computational demands and improving learning efficiency.

examples.description: Aims to develop a system with reduced computational complexity suitable for real-time applications by optimizing preprocessing and neural network parameters.
examples.note: Added for its aim to reduce computational complexity through optimization, making it suitable for real-time, resource-constrained applications.

examples.description: Optimizes computational costs by utilizing a multi-semantic approach to graph convolution and incorporating channel and spatial attention mechanisms.
examples.note: Added for its optimization of computational costs, demonstrating a method for reducing resource demands in complex models.

examples.description: Employs a shallow CNN to minimize computational complexity, achieving fast prediction times suitable for real-time detection.
examples.note: Added for its use of a shallow CNN to minimize computational complexity, showcasing an approach to achieving fast prediction times suitable for real-time detection.

trend: Development of lightweight and efficient models suitable for deployment on wearable devices and in-vehicle systems.
